TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by the police on suspicion of having stolen property .

CARDINAL . He was allegedly subjected to psychological pressure in order to confess to the crime with which he had been charged , following which he made self - incriminating statements . He subsequently confirmed his statements and asked the courts to reduce his sentence in view of his family ’s poor financial situation . He had allegedly had to steal in order to feed his family . He also claimed that he had never seen the ORG - appointed lawyer handling his case , who had signed all the documents relating to the matter after the fact in order to lend an appearance of legitimacy to the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was convicted by ORG . That judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE . The applicant did not inform the ORG of any subsequent judgments concerning his case .

CARDINAL . After his arrest , the applicant was detained in LOC police station for DATE in a cell measuring just over QUANTITY . m together with CARDINAL other detainees . It was impossible to sleep or sit there – one could only stand . There was no window or other means of ventilation .

CARDINAL . The applicant was subsequently transferred to the LOC of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) . However , he was brought back to LOC police station several times for further questioning and each time he was detained in the same QUANTITY . m cell as previously . In the ORG ’s premises he was placed in cell no . CARDINAL , which measures QUANTITY and in which CARDINAL detainees were held . The cell was unventilated , dirty and damp . No daily walk was allowed . A window of QUANTITY was covered with thick metal netting preventing almost all sunshine and air from reaching the cell . The cell had a toilet , next to the dining table . Water was available from a tap installed above the toilet . Detainees had to take turns to sleep . The cell was infested with parasitic insects . No bed linen was available . No doctor visited the cell . The prosecutor responsible for checking conditions of detention fully supported the police and did not take action in response to any complaints .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was transferred to prison no . CARDINAL in PERSON and placed in cell no . CARDINAL . The cell was in the basement , had no windows and was not heated ; it was very cold and damp . There were more detainees than sleeping places in the cell .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was transferred to prison no . CARDINAL in Cricova .
